main event: On April 6, 1949, a school bus driver observed three shiny, silver objects flying in a 'V' formation near Castleton, New York.
interesting points: The objects were reported to be spinning rapidly while flying high in the sky,The bus driver estimated the objects to be about twenty inches in diameter, resembling the size of a full moon,The objects seemed to disappear when a cloud passed overhead,Indications suggest the flight direction was toward Boston,Attempts to contact other potential witnesses were unsuccessful.
witness description: A school bus driver who is a respected citizen in his community.
